snippet: The spokesman said Ms. Sabbagh, a poet and activist hit with a blast of birdshot from a police shotgun during a march to Tahrir Square in Cairo, would have lived if she had not been so slender.
abstract: Spokesman for Egypt's medical examiner claims that Shaimaa el-Sabbagh, poet and activist who was killed by birdshot fired from police gun during march to Tahrir Square, died because she was so thin; asserts that someone with more body fat would have survived assault.
lead_paragraph: The spokesman said Ms. Sabbagh, a poet and activist hit with a blast of birdshot from a police shotgun during a march to Tahrir Square in Cairo, would have lived if she had not been so slender.

headline.main: Egyptian Official Says Protester, Shaimaa el-Sabbagh, Died in Shooting Because She Was Too Thin
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Official Says Protester Died in Shooting Because She Was Too Thin

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
